revised_title: Experiments on Pendulum Vibrations and the Effects of Heat and Cold
tldr: The author conducts experiments on pendulum vibrations and their response to changes in air pressure and temperature. He finds that vibrations are larger in a vacuum and that adding weight to a clock increases the vibrations, causing it to lose time. The author also investigates the effects of heat and cold on iron rods and suggests that these factors may contribute to the phenomenon of pendulum clocks running slower near the equator.
